sequence:
Journé Surcouf!

<size=45>Chapter 6 - Surcouf in the Afternoon Pt. 2</size>

scripts.say: Port - Commander's Office
Hey, wake up! ... I said WAKE UP, dammit!
I woke up to the feeling of something hitting me in the face.
Jean Bart was in the office. She was holding a stack of mission reports in her hand.
Your break ended 30 minutes ago, but apparently, you deserve longer breaks than everyone else.

options.content: ... Surcouf was supposed to wake me up

scripts.say: Surcouf? Ya mean Sleeping Beauty over there?
Following Jean Bart's gaze, I turned my head over to the sofa. There Surcouf was, sleeping soundly, like a toddler.
... I knew I couldn't trust her to wake me up.
Appointing this girl as your secretary was a mistake. Least if ya ask me.
Hate's a strong word. We're still part of the same fleet.
In short, she's the polar opposite of me in almost every way, and that's my beef with her.
For someone named after a famed pirate, she's got no ambition. There's a limit to how lazy you're allowed to be.
Besides, you really think she can do her job in this sorry state she's in?

options.content: Point to all the processed documents on your desk

scripts.say: Hey, yeah... This girl's no secretary, she's just a pet who's adapted to living in your office.
Shiver me timbers... Just looking at that mountain of paperwork makes my head spin...
What was that...? You went through 'em all on your own?
Are you saying your work gets done even if she's useless, and you don't even wish that she'd do anything useful?
Hmph. Whatever the hell suits you.
Zzzz... Commander... ehehe...
... Like two peas in a pod.
Got one last bit of advice for ya: you oughta wash your face before going out in public.
Jean Bart promptly left the office after finishing her sentence.
... Wash my face?
... Surcouf had left a kiss mark on my cheek.
